snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry’s statement appeared aimed at keeping up the pressure on President Bashar al-Assad, and to bolster the hope that a political settlement might be reached.
abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry issues statement blaming Syrian government for deadlock in peace talks but asserts continued commitment of United States to peace process; statement follows two rounds of generally fruitless discussions during which Syrian government continued its attacks on rebel-held areas and more than 200,000 Syrians remained cut off from humanitarian assistance.
lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry’s statement appeared aimed at keeping up the pressure on President Bashar al-Assad, and to bolster the hope that a political settlement might be reached.

headline.main: Kerry Blames Syrian Government for Deadlocked Talks
headline.print_headline: Kerry Blames Syrian Government for Deadlocked Talks
